title: In Time Of Drought, U.S. West's Alfalfa Exports Are Criticized
teaser: As the West moves more into a record-setting drought, many are taking a look at how water gets used. Alfalfa grown with Colorado River water is a case study of how and why water gets used as it does.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
